document_title: What is myasthenia gravis? Causes, symptoms, prevention
subsection_content:
Myasthenia Gravis is an autoimmune disease of the nerve-muscle junctions in patients, characterized by muscle weakness that fluctuates depending on the time of day, stronger in the morning than in the afternoon or weak. increases when the patient is overexerted and decreases when resting. Symptoms of muscle weakness are often seen in the eye muscles (ptosis), extraocular muscles, neck, shoulder, hip muscles, or respiratory muscles (fatigued breathing). (first)
When sick, the body will produce antibodies against the binding of Acetylcholine receptors (AChR) in the post-synaptic membrane. This reduces the ability to conduct nerve transmission across the synaptic gap, manifested by muscle fatigue, muscle weakness or motor paralysis.
